flawed_nl_solution:
Thomas originally orders chairs for 3 dozen guests, 12 x 3 = 63 guests
Thomas finds out that 1/3 of the guests want to bring a guest of their own, 1/3 of 63 = <<1/3*63=21>>21
The 21 guests bring a guest of their own each, 63 guests + 21 guests = <<63+21=84>>84
Thomas finds out that 20 of the guests can't make it, 84 guests - 5 guests = 79
Thomas wants to order an extra 12 chairs, 79 + 12 = <<79+12=91>>91
#### 91

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 36, not 63. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
